definition: how much there is or how many there are of something that you can quantify, express as a number or measure or quantity
details:
noun
- how much there is or how many there are of something that you can quantify
= synonyms: quantity, amount
- any maneuver made as part of progress toward a goal
= example: any maneuver made as part of progress toward a goal
= synonyms: step
- the act or process of assigning numbers to phenomena according to a rule
= example: the act or process of assigning numbers to phenomena according to a rule
= synonyms: measurement, measuring, mensuration
- a container of some standard capacity that is used to obtain fixed amounts of a substance
- measuring instrument having a sequence of marks at regular intervals
= example: measuring instrument having a sequence of marks at regular intervals
= synonyms: measuring stick, measuring rod
- a statute in draft before it becomes law
= synonyms: bill
- musical notation for a repeating pattern of musical beats
= synonyms: bar
- (prosody) the accent in a metrical foot of verse
= synonyms: beat, meter, metre, cadence
- a basis for comparison
= synonyms: standard, criterion, touchstone
verb
- express as a number or measure or quantity
= synonyms: quantify
- determine the measurements of something or somebody, take measurements of
= synonyms: mensurate, measure out
- evaluate or estimate the nature, quality, ability, extent, or significance of
= synonyms: value, appraise, valuate, assess, evaluate
- have certain dimensions
= example: have certain dimensions
